metadata.title: Ross Sea Food Web - Little Explorers
metadata.description: Learn about who eats who in the Ross Sea! Perfect for young marine biologists.
metadata.subject: Marine Biology

questions.question: The animal above is eaten by which animal below?
questions.explanation: Penguins love to eat krill! Krill are tiny shrimp-like creatures that swim in large groups called swarms. Penguins can eat hundreds of krill in one day!

questions.question: What does this animal eat?
questions.explanation: Seals are excellent hunters that catch and eat fish! They have sharp teeth and can swim very fast underwater to catch their prey.

questions.question: The tiny plants above are food for which animal?
questions.explanation: Krill eat phytoplankton! Phytoplankton are tiny plants that float in the water and make their own food using sunlight, just like plants on land!

questions.question: Which animal eats the fish shown above?
questions.explanation: Penguins catch and eat silverfish! These little fish are one of the penguin's favorite foods in the cold waters of Antarctica.

questions.question: What do these giant whales eat?
questions.explanation: Baleen whales eat krill! Even though these whales are huge, they eat tiny krill by filtering them through special plates in their mouths called baleen.

questions.question: The squid above is food for which predator?
questions.explanation: Toothed whales like sperm whales hunt and eat squid! They dive very deep in the ocean to catch them.

questions.question: What happens to dead plants and animals in the ocean?
questions.explanation: Bacteria are nature's recyclers! They break down dead plants and animals, returning nutrients to the water so new life can grow. This helps feed tiny plants like phytoplankton!

questions.question: What do the boats above catch from the Ross Sea?
questions.explanation: Fishing boats catch toothfish in the Ross Sea. These large fish are sold for food, but we must be careful not to catch too many!

questions.question: How do tiny ocean plants make their own food?
choices: They use sunlight like land plants
questions.explanation: Phytoplankton are tiny plants that float in the ocean. They use sunlight to make their own food through photosynthesis, just like trees and grass on land! They are food for krill.

questions.question: What do sea stars and worms on the ocean floor eat?
choices: Nothing - they make their own food
questions.explanation: Bottom-dwelling creatures like sea stars and worms eat 'marine snow' - bits of dead plants, animals, and waste that slowly sink down from the waters above!
